title: How to Make Blueberry Coffee Cake

steps.headline: Make the dry mixture.
steps.description: Sift and combine the 2 cups flour, salt, and baking powder in a medium bowl.

steps.headline: Make the wet mixture.
steps.description: In a large bowl, beat the 1/3 cup butter with the 3/4 cup sugar. Add the eggs one at a time.

steps.headline: Add the dry ingredients to the wet bowl, stirring divided amounts at a time, alternatively with the milk.
Fold the blueberries in the bowl.
Make the topping.
steps.description: Whisk the 1/2 cup sugar, 1/3 cup flour, 1/4 cup butter, and cinnamon in a medium bowl.

steps.headline: Pour the mixture in a pre-greased 9x12-inch (23x30 cm) pan.
steps.description: Sprinkle the topping on top of the mixture.

text: Preheat the oven to 375ºF/190ºC.  Make the dry mixture. Sift and combine the 2 cups flour, salt, and baking powder in a medium bowl. Make the wet mixture. In a large bowl, beat the 1/3 cup butter with the 3/4 cup sugar. Add the eggs one at a time. Add the dry ingredients to the wet bowl, stirring divided amounts at a time, alternatively with the milk.  Fold the blueberries in the bowl.  Make the topping. Whisk the 1/2 cup sugar, 1/3 cup flour, 1/4 cup butter, and cinnamon in a medium bowl. Pour the mixture in a pre-greased 9x12-inch (23x30 cm) pan. Sprinkle the topping on top of the mixture. Bake for 25 to 30 minutes.  Finished.
